title: Shocked Gaza survivors trickle through Rafah crossing as truckloads of aid wait
summary: Since October 21, almost 9,000 people have been evacuated through the crossing at the border with Egypt, the only way out of the Palestinian enclave.

title: Renewed hope for the family of Marah Bakir, on the list of Palestinian prisoners to be released
summary: The 23-year-old has been imprisoned in Israel for eight years. Her name is on the list of the first 33 detainees to be exchanged for Israeli hostages, according to the agreement sealed between Hamas and the Hebrew state.

title: In the Netherlands, demonstrations break out after far-right win
summary: Members of left-wing parties in Utrecht organized the protests on Thursday evening in Utrecht and Amsterdam. Geert Wilders stunned the Dutch establishment by winning 37 seats in parliament – by far the largest party.

title: How Le Monde articles inspired a bill to rehabilitate people convicted of homosexuality in France
summary: On Wednesday, France's Sénat passed a bill providing for compensation for people convicted under discriminatory laws against homosexuality between 1945 and 1982.

title: How many people were convicted of homosexuality in France?
summary: Until 1982, homosexuality was criminalized in France, punishable by three years' imprisonment. The Sénat passed a bill to rehabilitate and compensate the people convicted under those discriminatory laws. But as historian Régis Schlagdenhauffen points out, the number of victims of this repression is difficult to establish.

title: US President Biden takes a dip on Thanksgiving
summary: The White House confirmed that President Biden, who turned 81 on Monday, had taken part in the chilly family swim on Nantucket island, Massachusetts.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Hezbollah pledges to respect upcoming truce in Lebanon
summary: Fighting between Israeli forces and Shiite militia has continued on the Lebanese border, pending the agreed ceasefire in exchange for the release of hostages held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip.

title: The threatened harmony between São Paulo's Jewish and Muslim communities
summary: The Brazilian model of peaceful coexistence between religions is being challenged by the war between Hamas and Israel. Faced with a rise in anti-Semitic and Islamophobic acts, clerics are trying to preserve inter-religious dialogue.

title: FBI ends investigation of car crash at Canada border, no sign of terrorism
summary: The two people who died were a husband and wife. Local police are now handling the case as a traffic investigation.

title: Violent protests break out in Dublin after knife attack that injured 3 children, one seriously
summary: Irish police armed with shields fended off violent demonstrators attempting to kick and punch them.

title: COP28 will be a 'moment of truth' for the oil and gas industry, says IEA
summary: An International Energy Agency report points out that the sector is not currently a 'serious partner' in the fight against global warming.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: 15,000 soldiers will take part in security set-up
summary: The bulk of the military force – nearly 10,000 troops – will be deployed in the Paris region, where most Olympic events will be concentrated.

title: Russian women's groups protest against 'endless mobilization' of soldiers
summary: Mothers and wives hope for the return of their loved ones sent to fight in Ukraine since September 2022. But their demand is not on the Kremlin's agenda.

title: Qatar says Gaza truce to start early Friday, hostage release hours later
summary: The deal approved on Wednesday will allow for the release of 50 women and children held hostage by Hamas and 150 Palestinians imprisoned by Israel, over four days.

title: Far-right Geert Wilders wins Dutch election but could struggle to form coalition
summary: Wilders' Party for Freedom took 37 of the 150 seats in the Second Chamber, according to exit polls. In order to govern, it will have to reach an agreement with right-wing and center-right parties.

title: In the run-up to the UK elections, the government cuts taxes (a little)
summary: The government's budget statement shows that the Conservatives have overseen the largest decline in living standards since the 1950s.

title: Despite extensive lobbying, the European Parliament votes to regulate packaging
summary: While packaging waste continues to rise in the European Union, future regulations should help to reverse the trend and reduce its use by 10% by 2035.

title: South Korea court rules in favor of victims of wartime sexual slavery
Lobbyist David Cameron's return to UK government met with irritation and concern
summary: The former prime minister's appointment as foreign secretary is not going down well. His reputation is weighed down by his recent career as a lobbyist, in particular for China.

title: Even wars have rules. What are they?
summary: VIDEO – The Israel-Hamas war has provoked widespread reactions denouncing war crimes. But what exactly are the rules of war?
